title: Former Carnival staff set up travel employer review site
text:
Save 
Two former senior managers who previously worked for Carnival UK have set up a new website allowing travel professionals to give anonymous reviews of their employers. 
The website, workadvisor.co.uk, has been created by Philip Price, who was previously marketing director for P&O Cruises, and Paul Moran, who worked in Carnival UK’s commercial department, as a way of giving staff the chance to rate the company they work for. TTG Media will be the new site’s media partner. 
The WorkAdvisor review system gives employees the chance to review and rate their company on five key metrics, such as whether it is a “fun and sociable place to work”, how staff are motivated, career development, job security and if they would recommend the company as an employer. 
These marks are then combined to give the company an overall performance rating from one to five. 
Price said: “We review and talk about our holidays, a meal out and even our latest gadget purchase but the place where we spend 58% of our waking hours - at work - is ignored. 
“Employee reviews are a great way for people in travel to let both their company and potential employees know what it is really like to work in that business. 
“But this is not about showing travel companies in a bad light. We expect the majority of reviews to be positive, whereas others will show how employers can engage more effectively with their people.” 
The site offers travel firms the chance to respond to comments and ratings from employees in a similar way to TripAdvisor. They can also promote their brand by uploading information, videos and interviews.
